etymologies: late 17th century: modern Latin, translation of Greek hulē iatrikē ‘healing material’ (the title of a work by Dioscorides)

definitions: the body of remedial substances used in the practice of medicine

examples.text: his confidence in materia medica tends to waver

shortDefinitions: body of remedial substances used in practice of medicine

definitions: the study of the origin and properties of remedial substances used in medicine

examples.text: to one Professor is assigned Human Anatomy and Materia Medica

shortDefinitions: study of origin and properties of substances used in practice of medicine
